attributes.action: withdraw Britain from Kyoto and its fruitless obligations
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
(edited to fit word limit)

A major new scientific study concludes the impact of carbon dioxide emissions on worldwide temperatures is largely irrelevant, prompting one veteran meteorologist to quip, "You can go outside and spit and have the same effect as doubling carbon dioxide."  

"Heat Capacity, Time Constant, and Sensitivity of Earth's Climate System" is the study, authored by Brookhaven National lab scientist Stephen Schwartz.  

The temperature of the earth is increasing, but that it's got nothing to do with what man is doing. . . . . 

. . . a long list of doubters of catastrophic, man-made global warming . . .  

"Effectively, this means that the global economy will spend trillions of dollars trying to avoid a warming . . . . . . 

Ivy League geologist Robert Giegengack, chairman of the Department of Earth and Environmental Science at the University of Pennsylvania, said he doesn't even consider global warming among the top 10 environmental problems. . . . .
